summary: TYLCV is a begomovirus, which is the largest and most economically important group of plant viruses transmitted by the whitefly Bemisia tabaci. the insect gut as a barrier for viral entry and dissemination is thought to regulate the vector specificity. but due to its tiny size, information for the responses of whitefly gut to virus infection is limited. deGs involved in Lysosome of viruliferous guts in comparison to nonviruliferous guts. bFC, fold change (log2 ratio) of gene expression.
